name: noteboard-app
description: My final project for the Awesome Inc U Full-Stack Web Developer Bootcamp. Noteboard is a simple note-making and note-sharing app.

name: google-keep-mvp
description: A mockup MVP created for Google Keep featuring a kanban project board.

name: laravel-library
description: A database created to store data for a library website.

name: superfacebook-api
description: The first back-end project of the bootcamp. We created a database to store data and relationships for a superhero and villain social media site.

name: fishing-hooks-app
description: A mockup fishing store page utilizing React Hooks as well as an in-house products data API.

name: todo-list-app
description: Creating a ToDo list app using ReactJS. Our first project utilizing local storage, hosted on Firebase.

name: restaurant-app
description: The first React project. We designed a restaurant menu app using ReactJs and an in-house food data API.

name: tictactoe-app
description: A JavaScript project featuring object-oriented programming and lots of logic to create a basic tictactoe game app. Mobile only. (a.k.a. I didn't get to resolving responsiveness issues).

name: weather-app
description: The first major JavaScript project of the bootcamp. It features functional programming and an axios call to the OpenWeather api to gather location-based weather data.

name: mind-reader-app
description: A simple click-through app to practice our ability to replicate a wireframe.

name: bouncing-balls-app
description: A small side project to practice object-oriented programming in JavaScript.

name: alarm-clock-app
description: Our first JavaScript project: to develop a live clock app with an alarm setting.

name: silly story generator
description: Our first assignment using JavaScript to conditionally render elements on a page.

name: Birdwatching Project
description: A simple webpage mockup assignment creating a fake birdwatching site to practice web element placement and structuring.
